reviews.text: Great value for money in good accomodation in a good location with a genuinely helpful host. Panos is a "loveable rogue" and makes the place tick; if he went it would be a different place. Its not perched on the edge of the caldera but its literally only 100m away along a pathway. If we went back we'd (1) double check that the booking was in fact in place (administration is not Panos's strong point!) and (2) try hard to get a top floor apartment reserved. Would stay again anyway.
reviews.title: Spot on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't get me wrong this is not a bad hotel, in fact way above average but it really is overrated by many reviewers on this site.
reviews.title: Somewhat Overrated

likes.disliked: — Location and not the best value for money

reviews.text: Looked at objectively, it has good service, a convenient, albeit slightly anti-climatic location (very near the bus stop) and nice rooms.
reviews.title: I could have lived there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having lived in Greece for a year a few years back I have encountered Greek hospitality and have to say that although Panos' and his staff are very good they are not as out of this world as stated by many reviewers.
reviews.title: Pretty Perfect

reviews.text: Don't go expecting Utopia is essentially my message, otherwise you may well be a little under-whelmed like I was with my girlfriend.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Amazingly Friendly Staff

likes.liked: — The freindly staff, atmoshere, and proximity to the caldera views

reviews.title: Delightful
reviews.text: Truly the most lovely place to stay in every way and I'm really pleased to see that everyone mentions Panos - they are all right too. He is a wonderful, warm, welcoming, helpful and fun person who is always ready to sit down and have a coffee/chat/beer or give help or information. We will definitely be returning there soon. Annette

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our honeymoon and could not have been happier with the apartments, the location and the best part of all - meeting Panos.
reviews.title: You Must Stay Here!!!!

reviews.text: We read the reviews on trip advisor before booking this hotel- and can I say it was better that we could have imagined. The apartments offer value for money, a central location and a homely atmosphere. We must say a special thankyou to Panos for being the main reason that we enjoyed our stay so much.
reviews.title: Brilliant accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled from Australia and were pleased to spend this time at Oia Sunsets. We'll remeber our Santorini experience as being extra special because of Panos and Oia Sunsets.
reviews.title: All roads lead to Oia's Sunset

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartments are wonderful: centrally located, just next to the bus stops, close to shops, spacious, welcoming, not noisy at all, due to the way they are build. I have to say I agree with all of the other reviews Panos is the best host!!! I went there with my parents and have to say that we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Although there is no actual beach to speak of near Oia, the hotel does have its own swimming pool. The bar is always open and if you ever need someone to recommend food, recommend somewhere to go, offer medical help, food, drinks... Panos is the man!! brilliant accomodation, would go back there now if I wasn't at work.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Oias Sunset for 3 nights in June and loved every minute of it. Panos, the manager is great in making all his guests feel welcome and at home. It was great fun just watching him greet everyone and welcome them with a drink.
reviews.title: Just great!!

likes.liked: — Location and atmosphere, friendliness of staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an apartment which had 2 rooms and a kitchen and would easily have accomodated up to 5 people. We also had an outside porch area with a table and lounge chairs. Our room did not have a view but as we were out all day we did not need it as we were walking around admiring the beautiful views all day.
reviews.title: Super Friendly Staff and Beautiful Pool

reviews.text: The room was serviced daily, very clean and comfortable. Panos personally served breakfast every morning near the pool area which included freshly cut up fruit salad and his home made yoghurt.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.text: The location is excellent, very close to the main bus terminal and a short walk to the main street of shops and views of the Caldera.
reviews.title: Great time with Oia's Sunset and Panos

reviews.text: The accomodation is reasonably priced compared to the accommodation overlooking the Caldera. Also people need to be aware that most of the units overlooking the Caldera that are on the cliffs and in the caves, and seem very attractive with stunning views , have alot of steep stairs and are hard to negotiate especially when carrying luggage.
reviews.title: A fab place to stay..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel and wonderful people! Panos greeted us with our beverage of choice (beer and wine in this case), and the hotel is one block away from the bus drop off and 5 minutes from the best view of the famous Oia Sunset. Our hotel room was clean, comfortable and simple (we’ve uploaded pictures to see). Bed and pillows very comfortable. Panos was very helpful in planning our treks be it scuba diving or the volcanic excursions. Be sure to ask Panos for restaurant recommendations – he really knows the area well!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so excited to arrive at Oia's Sunset, especially after reading all the glowing reports on TripAdvisor! The room did not disappoint. It was simple and lovely with a great view of the sky. The fridge was super handy as we ended up keeping some food at the place since everything was SO expensive!! Each room has its own lounge chair and umbrella which was so nice. Panos was very helpful and kind- he welcomed us with a bottle of wine (for our honeymoon), and he was more than happy to give recommendations and ideas of things to do. He was incredibly responsive during the booking and always got back to me the same day. The only downside were the following: 1) our room was right next to one of the main walkways and it was very loud, especially when the cruise tour groups poured in and out; 2) there really isn't a view of the water or much of the sunset- mostly of other beautiful white buildings. This is fine, but if you are hoping to lounge around and enjoy views of the water, this is not the place. Overall, it was a good place to stay. But if you are someone who likes to lounge by the pool or who would enjoy taking in the view, I would probably stay somewhere with the a caldera view (it really is spectacular!).
reviews.title: GREAT, but. . .

likes.disliked: — Noisy, would have liked a view of the caldera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in late May-early June 2008 having previously stayed for 4 nights in September 2007. Both times we had a great stay and would recommend this place to anyone. The host is great and makes you feel very welcome when you arrive and whenever you want to have a drink by the pool. The rooms are simple, but very clean and comfortable and there is a good pool to lounge around. Although the apartments are not on the caldera side of Oia, you can walk up to the main square of Oia and view of the caldera in about 30 seconds from the front gate. This place is fantastic value for money in a village that can be a bit of a tourist trap. I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone and would happily go back to stay a third time.
reviews.title: Great place - good value, simple, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! My wife and I just got back from a 10 day stay in Oia and loved everything. We originally booked two nights at the Sunset Apartments-- we wanted some flexibilty to barter with other hotels or visit other islands. After speaking with travelers and looking around, we extended our stay for the full ten days. Considering amenities and location, the value could not be beat. Accomodation was incredibly clean, great location and the pool/bar was a tranquil place to hang.
reviews.title: Great Views, Value and Host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Panos(and his "sidekick", Leon) was a highlight of our trip. Just an incredible guy and full of great advice. Any list of things to do and see would be too overwhelming to write. For the best source, go right to Panos while you sip on something from his bar.
reviews.title: Great Accommodation
